name: fash
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U often before noun ] usually humorous short for
fashion : clothes, styles, etc. that are popular at a particular time, especially with people who are interested in clothes or like to spend a lot of money on them: There is a link between football and fashion, especially the kind of flashy fash beloved of the paparazzi. This new boutique opened on in Milan on October 1, just in time for the arrival of the fash pack for Milan fashion week. She's this year's coolest designer, according to absolutely every fash mag.
[ plural ] disapproving short for
fascist s: people on the far right of politics: A flier distributed around the campus encouraged students to “bash the fash!”, meaning physically assault fascists.
More examplesFewer examplesI still love a pashmina, even though the pash may be out of fash.He'd better not make that kind of fash error again if he wants to be on TV.The geometric print has always held a certain appeal for the fash pack. That was the year that short hair re-entered the fash arena.

short for
fashionable : used to describe clothes, places, etc. that are in fashion or people who wear clothes like this, go to places like this, etc.: Although the club's dresscode is "glitz and glam", it's not really — the crowd is more rough than fash.

fash yourself
to worry or be upset: The lass will be fine; don't fash yourself. He could be heard muttering, "Dinna fash yourself, lassie."
